summary: This bill, the State Public Option Act, aims to establish a state public option for health insurance through Medicaid, allowing residents to buy into the program. It amends the Social Security Act to include a Medicaid buy-in option, sets federal financial participation rates for administrative costs, and addresses cost-sharing requirements. The bill also includes measures to update Medicaid quality measures, renew the application of Medicare payment rate floor to primary care services, increase federal medical assistance percentage (FMAP) for certain individuals, and requires Medicaid coverage of comprehensive sexual and reproductive health care services.
